docs.title: Anomaly Detection Architecture (Open Docs)
docs.text: This site documents our anomaly-detection system: high-level architecture, flows, scoring, and implementation notes. It is maintained by Tese.io and open to community contributions.

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
• Orchestrator — routes a user's question + files to relevant pipelines.
  • Text Q&A Flow — extracts answers from historical text; returns confidence.
  • Document Analysis Flow — processes PDFs/Images; OCR + tamper checks.

docs.title: Data Flow (overview)
docs.text:
1. Ingest question and optional files.
  2. Select flow(s) based on inputs.
  3. Aggregate evidence; compute scores; return final JSON response.

docs.title: Scoring & Final Output
docs.text:
We compute: - AnswerScore — accuracy/consistency of the produced answer. - TamperScore — likelihood of manipulation in supplied documents. - SupportScore — strength of evidence supporting the answer.

Final JSON (example fields): answer, confidence, answer_score, tamper_score, support_score, evidence[], diagnostics{}

docs.title: Document Analysis Flow
docs.text:
Goal: Validate document authenticity and consistency; flag anomalies.

Inputs: PDFs/images; Outputs: extracted fields, tamper indicators, support evidence.

docs.title: Text Q&A Flow
docs.text:
Goal: Detect anomalies in long-form textual answers compared with historical distributions; provide an accurate answer + confidence.

Inputs: question, historical answers. Outputs: answer, confidence, evidence excerpts.
